ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Lvl 52 song
ygData.msgSnippet: ... definitely that large difference in the way we play is going to result in a large difference of our views on the class.  for example while most of us
ygData.messageBody:
At 03:07 PM 3/1/01 -0500, you wrote:
>i think that is where a lot of our experiences differ, since i am rarely
>fighting normal mobs anymore. most of my experience in 58 has been on mobs
>that double for 190s and are magic (root) immune. and the uber stuff hits
>for insane amounts of damage. stepping away may help, but i see mobs
>turning off me right away as soon as Song of Dawn pulses all the time. i
>see mobs that no one else has even aggro'd turn off me when i pulse it.
>it's a nice song that works well and i find a lot of use out of it. now if
>i feel the need for something more important, i'll got with it. Song of
>Dawn is in one of my often-changed song slots, but i do have it memmed a
>lot.

definitely that large difference in the way we play is going to result in a large
difference of our views on the class. for example while most of us consider
charm a staple song, you probably don't even have it memmed most of the
time, right? actually it would be kind of interesting to see what your ''normal''
song list does contain, if you don't mind giving out that info, heh.


>Shada
